libshapedraw.primitive
Class LineStyle

java.lang.Object
  libshapedraw.primitive.LineStyle
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, ReadonlyLineStyle
public class LineStyle
extends Object
implements ReadonlyLineStyle

Represent a line style: a Color and a floating point width. Optionally, the line style can have a secondary Color/width as well.

All modifiers support method chaining, e.g. LineStyle result = new LineStyle(Color.WHITE.copy(), 5.0F, true).setSecondaryWidth(2.0F);

See Also:

glApply

public boolean glApply(boolean useSecondary)
Description copied from interface: ReadonlyLineStyle
Convenience method that sets the OpenGL state to match this line style. I.e., call glColor4d, glLineWidth, and glDepthFunc.

Specified by:
glApply in interface ReadonlyLineStyle
Returns:
false if the OpenGL state was not set due to the secondary color not being set for this line style.

isAnimating

public boolean isAnimating()
Specified by:
isAnimating in interface ReadonlyLineStyle
Returns:
true if either of this line style's colors is being updated by an active animation.

The line widths can be animated by a Timeline too, but not an internal one: LineStyle does not implement the full Animates interface.

set

public LineStyle set(Color color,
                     float width,
                     boolean hasSecondaryColor)
Convenience method to set mainColor, mainWidth, secondaryColor, and secondaryWidth at once.

Parameters:
color - sets mainColor
width - sets both mainWidth and secondaryWidth
hasSecondaryColor - if true, secondaryColor will be a semi-transparent version of mainColor. If false, secondaryColor is null.
Returns:
the same line style object, modified in-place.

public LineStyle set(Color mainColor,
                     float mainWidth,
                     Color secondaryColor,
                     float secondaryWidth)
Set all components of this line style.

Returns:
the same line style object, modified in-place.
